DOC.brief_summary: The central hypothesis Fueling Learning Through Exercise ( FLEX ) study two innovative school-based physical activity program ( walking/running program classroom activity break program ) increase school-time total daily minute child engage moderate-to-vigorous physical activity , relative control , child attend school PA program demonstrate improve cognitive functioning , academic achievement , attendance , relative control .
DOC.brief_title: Understanding Impact School-Based Physical Activity Programs
DOC.detailed_description: The FLEX Study three-year , randomize control trial seek understand two different innovative school-based physical activity ( PA ) program influence child 's time spend MVPA also cognitive academic outcome . The FLEX Study implement evaluated researcher Tufts University . The project fund National Institutes Health . Schools participate study randomly assign receive walking/running program , classroom physical activity program , program ( control ) first year half study . Third fourth grade child enrol study . Physical activity assess objectively use accelerometry . Additional measurement include : BMI/BMI-z ( measure height weight ) , diet physical activity questionnaire , cognitive functioning ( test work memory inhibitory control ) .
DOC.criteria: Children participants 3rd 4th grade student participate school ( first school year study ) Not 3rd 4th grade student
